alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Greene; Oconee (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 28 at 8:45PM EDT until March 29 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River near Penfield affecting Clarke, Greene and Oconee Counties. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield, Milledgeville, Oconee, Oconee, McIntyre, Irwinton, Oconee, Dublin, Mount Vernon... Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oconee River near Penfield. * WHEN...From late tonight to late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 13 feet, Flood Stage is reached. Minor flooding occurs along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on the Georgia Highway 15 bridge. The right bank begins to overflow into agricultural land and pastures with a foot or two of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 12.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 13.1 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 13 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.1 feet on 01/10/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
